alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:02PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Missoula, south central Lake and southeastern Sanders Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Evaro, or 14 miles north of Missoula, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arlee, Evaro, and Frenchtown. This includes Highway 93 N between mile markers 2 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
